<RESUME_START>
FLORAL DESIGNER

SUMMARY

I am a retail floral designer who is energetic, outgoing and detail-oriented.
I can handle multiple responsibilities simultaneously while providing exceptional customer service.
I have been in floral sales for 13 years and in other avenues of retail sales for over 20 years.
I am a driven and results-focused professional seeking a position in a company in which I can share my talents.

EXPERIENCE


10/2014 to 01/2015
Company Name
City ,
State
Plan arrangement according to client's requirements, utilizing knowledge of design and properties of materials, or select appropriate standard design pattern.
Cheerfully assisted staff to have a productive and festive holiday season.
Resolve customer complaints regarding sales and service.
Greet customers and ascertain what each customer wants or needs.
Attended sales seminar to learn techniques for increasing sales for each order.Suggestive selling.
Floral Designer

01/2006 to 09/2014
Company Name
City ,
State
Open store in morning.
Filing sales receipts, taking phone orders, collecting orders from Teleflora Dove system.
Confer with clients and giving quality customer service regarding price and type of floral arrangement or gourmet fruit basket desired and the date, time, and place of delivery.
Trim material and arrange bouquets, wreaths, terrariums, and other items using trimmers, shapers, wire, pins, floral tape, foam, and other materials.
Perform office and retail service duties such as keeping financial records, serving customers, answering telephones, selling giftware items and receiving payment.
Inform customers about the care, maintenance, and handling of various flowers and foliage, indoor plants, and other items.
Decorate or supervise the decoration of buildings, halls, churches, or other facilities for parties, weddings and other occasions.
Itemize and total customer merchandise selection at checkout counter, using cash register, and accept cash or charge card for purchases.
Attend floral symposiums to learn the latest floral trends for weddings and everyday design.
Design and set up advertising signs and displays of merchandise on shelves, counters, or tables to attract customers and promote sales.
Floral Designer

07/2002 to 11/2005
Company Name
City ,
State
Worked in a dedicated team of six floral designers being able to multi task between selling, designing and answering the phone.
Created floral designs for hospital functions and organized delivery for on time arrival for the event.
Monitor customer preferences to determine focus of sales efforts.
Place prices or descriptive signs on backdrops, fixtures, merchandise, or floor.
Motivated staff to be positive and to give exceptional customer service in a hospital environment.
Take inventory or examine merchandise to identify items to be reordered or replenished.
Stock shelves, racks, cases, bins, and tables with new or transferred merchandise.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Supplier Quality Engineer

Location: Michigan City, IN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Manufacturing, Quality Assurance

Description:
Job DescriptionSummary of the position:
Looking for an enthusiastic self-motivated Supplier Quality Engineer who thrives in a fast-paced environment. The successful candidate is comfortable performing a wide range of tasks from administrative to tactical to strategic.
Supplier Quality Engineer is responsible for establishing and maintaining a professional proactive relationship between the organization and the quality department for each supplier. This person will be the lead for supplier system, product, and product approvals. In addition, this person will be responsible for working with key suppliers on obtaining complete problem resolution with the goal of zero defects through continuously improving the suppliers’ internal processes. 
The position will be located on-site in Michigan City, Indiana.
Duties and responsibilities:Participates in Supplier Transitions, New Product Development (NPD) and Cost ReductionProjects with responsibility for successful supplier quality performance.Conducts supplier quality audits of potential new suppliers and current suppliers: system, process and product.Approval of supplier PPAP submissions. Completion of PPAP reviews at supplier facility.Verification of dimensional and material / test certifications.Reviews FMEAs, Control Plans and other supplier documentation for adequacy.Responsible for implementation and maintenance of Supplier Quality Metrics.Communicates supplier performance to the organization and supply chain base by maintaining supplier quality performance data and metrics.Executes a supplier improvement strategy for the organization.Measures and drives supplier performance improvements for using applicable quality and continuous improvement tools.Works with supplier on process evaluation and continuous improvement.Drives communication with supplier to improve process capability of supplied products.Leads team with Supply Chain, Engineering, Manufacturing, and Supplier on root cause analysis for quality issues on purchased products.Trains and mentor suppliers on core Quality Tools: PFMEA, Control Plan, PPAP Submission, RRCA , etc.Executes improvement and maintenance plans for Supplier Quality processes and documents (Supplier Quality Manual, Supplier Assessment, Process Audits, Corrective Action Process, Supplier Assessment Surveillance, etc.).Travel to assigned suppliers, as necessary (domestic and international). Up to 50% travel.
Qualifications:
Education:• Bachelor’s Degree in related field (Engineering or Technical Field is preferred).• Six Sigma and/or ASQ Certifications are preferred.
Professional experience:
Must have solid understand of ISO 9001, ISO 14001, and OHSAS 18001 management systems. Certification as Internal Auditor or Lead Assessor preferred.Knowledge of GD&T8D/SCARDrive APQP activities at suppliersFollow up with suppliers in part development in a timely mannerEvaluate PPAP documentation and align with HGAP requirementsConduct onsite supplier onboardingProcess audits and Product audits and vendor endsAnalyze quality issues at supplier end and work on RCA and corrective actions closureConstant follow up with suppliers to ensure they support FAI, PPAP, etc. in a timely mannerKnowledge of PPAP, Supplier Audit, 7QC Tool, 8D, SPC, Gauge R&R etc.Must have a minimum of 5 years of experience in Supplier Quality Assurance in a manufacturing setting.Experience in Advanced Quality Planning including familiarity with the AIAG Advanced Quality Planning and Control Plan, FMEAs, PPAPs, MSA and Statistical Process Control (SPC) standards.Demonstrated ability to work effectively with suppliers to resolve problems using Root Cause Corrective Actions (RCCA) tools.Experience with working with corporate and small family-owned suppliers utilizing the appropriate methodologies for RRCA and Continuous Improvement tools and developing/maintaining supplier partnerships.ASQ Certifications Preferred – CQA, CQE,CQM, CSQP.Knowledge and experience with Continuous Improvement Methodologies (6 Sigma, Lean Mfg. etc.)Green Belt/Six Sigma Black Belt certification – a plus.Experience in SAP – a plus.
Key behaviors:Ability to think critically, anticipating/recognizing problems and resolving in a timely manner.Ability to lead both internal and supplier cross functional teams.
Direct reports:N/A

The successful candidate is responsible for complying with Hitachi Global Air Power US Code of Ethics and related policies. In performing the job, the incumbent shall take all steps necessary to comply with our safety rules and requirements and must actively support the organization's efforts to meet and exceed its goals of creating and maintaining a safe workplace.
This description is to serve as a guide. It is intended to be flexible and will continue to evolve over time with business needs and demands and may be updated periodically and at the Company's discretion.
Hitachi Global Air Power US is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate based on race, religion, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, veteran status, physical or mental disability, or other protected categories under applicable law, whether in recruitment, employment, promotion, transfer, compensation, or other conditions of employment.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
